availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Corum (Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier.)

body.p: Green County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Corum and Nancy Corum. Married to Susan Melvina Noe Corum in Green County, Kentucky, on June 19, 1859. Father of William Corum and James H. Corum. Resident of Green County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Green County in 1860. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from August 27, 1863. Served in the 6th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private to September 6, 1865.
